title: Marine Conservation and Policy
description: Examination of how science and policy are used to evaluate and implement marine conservation and resource management. Topics include endangered species, fisheries, climate change, marine protected areas, research and conservation topics and developing policy for management decision-making. Mandatory field trips required. 3 lectures, 1 laboratory.
prerequisites: BIO 160 and BIO 263; BIO 325 or BIO 327 or BIO 328 or BIO 401 or BOT 326, or Graduate standing in Biological Sciences
